column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
Information on the range of services available to support families
Offering independent advice and support to parents/carers who have children with special educational needs.
Frequently asked questions about Parent and Toddler Groups. For information on local groups contact 0161 342 5434
• Parking
For locations and charges of pay and display car parks in the Borough and contract car park passes
• Parks and Recreation Grounds
We can offer support to children, adults and their families/carers
Links to the websites of some of our partners
• Partnerships
In accordance with Government Guidance, the Tameside Strategic Partnership is the Local Strategic Partnership for the Borough
• Passport to Learning
A managed learning environment for all residents of Tameside
• Patient Information Centre
Infopatient is the Patient Information Centre based at Tameside General Hospital.
Bringing higher levels of safety and security to the streets of Tameside.
For details of the Council's road and maintenance programme
You can now pay your Council Tax and NCHT rent by cash at any of the PayPoint agencies
• Payments
On-line payments can be made here for a variety of bills and Council services. Visit the appropriate webpage for the service you require and use the payment links.
• Pedestrian crossings
Frequently asked questions and answers and a problem reporting form
• Pension Fund
The Greater Manchester Pension Fund administers the Local Governent Pension Scheme for the Greater Manchester area
• Pensioners
Information about financial help available to pensioners
• Pensioner's Concessionary Bus Pass
Frequently asked questions about the concessionary travel pass and an application form
Links to the community database holding details of Pentecostal Churches within the Borough
The Corporate Plan is, in accordance with Government guidelines, our annual Best Value Performance Plan
• Pest Control
The council provides a discreet, humane service to get rid of rats, mice and insect pests from homes
• Pet Shop Licence
Apply for a Pet Shop Licence
Tells you what you need to do to bring your pet into Britain through the Pet Travel Scheme (PETS) without putting it into quarantine
• Pharmacist
Links to the NHS website where you can locate your local Health Services
For location details of photocopiers available for public use
• Photographic Archive
Browse through our extensive archive of local history photographs
Links to a host of information for people with disabilities
Discover Tameside - The Undiscovered Gem of the North West. Tameside has something for everyone!
• Planning
General information about planning and building control, frequently asked questions, how to apply for planning permission etc
To search the database of planning applications and decisions or to make an online planning application
For information on sites and equipment
Sessional daycare for children aged 2 to 5
• Poisons
For more information on the Tameside Police Force including the PVP - Public Voice on Policing
• Poll Tax
Frequently Asked Questions about this tax which is also known as the Community Charge
Links to information from the Environmental Protection Section who carry out a number of key pollution related services
• Portage Service
Portage is a multi agency home visiting service for families with very young children who have additional needs
Housed at the junction of three canals, this exciting visitor attraction houses artifacts and memorabilia of bygone days. Free Admission
• Postal Voting
If you are unable to go to your Polling Station on election day you can apply for a postal vote
• Post Offices
You can pay your Council Tax and New Charter Housing Trust rent by cash or cheque at any Post Office
Use the on-line system to report potholes in the carriageway
• Power of Attorney
DirectGov provides information on managing your affairs and enduring power of attorney
• Press and Public Relations Unit
For the latest press release issues or to use the electronic form to make press enquiries
For a list of all primary schools within the Borough
• Prisons and Probation
DirectGov provides information on prisons and probation
A list of registered private and voluntary childrens' home
Private Day Nurseries are registered childcare facilities which offer both full and part time childcare for children from 0-5 years
• Private Hire Vehicles
Hackney carriage and private hire vehicles, drivers and owners are licensed by the council
• Private sector tenants
Help and advice is available to private tenants and owner occupiers. Housing Options Centre, Warrington Street, Ashton-under-Lyne, 0161 331 2700
A Community Rehabilitation Order was previously a Probation Order and it is a Court Order, which is made to help you to avoid further offending
For up-to-date information on the supply and delivery of goods and services
General advice regarding product and toy safety
• Properties for Sale
For details of council owned properties and land for sale and shops to let
The Land Terrier is a computerised system of large scale ordnance survey maps showing the boundaries of all land owned by the Council
An on-line database detailing all private prosecution cases taken by Tameside MBC since 1st January 2002 which have resulted in a conviction
A guide to Tree Preservation Orders plus an interactive database
What to do if you are concerned about the welfare of a child
• Protection of Vulnerable Adults
What to do if you know of a worrying situation involving suspected abuse of an adult
• Proxy Voting
If you are unable to go to your Polling Station on election day you can apply to vote by post or nominate a proxy (someone who votes on your behalf)
Providing advice and assessment for children on their development, behaviour and educational needs
• Public Conveniences
Find out where they are and use the on-line form to report a problem
Details of Public Rights of Way within Tameside. For details of the Council's Road Maintenance Programme
• Public Halls and Meeting Rooms
For details of Town Halls and Community Buildings
• Public Information Sheets
Details of common pests such as wasps, fleas, feral pigeons, garden ants together with control and care of dogs and their ownership
• Public Notices Search
Search for Traffic Management Orders that are being imposed or tested in Tameside (e.g. speed bumps and other traffic calming initiatives).
• Public Register of Authorised Processes
For a list of industrial premises authorised and inspected by the Council in relation to air pollution emissions
• Public Rights of Way
Details of Public Rights of Way within Tameside
Tameside has become one of the first councils in the country to sign a Local Public Service Agreement with Government
• Public Transport
Links to GMPTE's web site detailing timetables for local buses, trains and trams.
• Publications for Sale
to view the catalogue of publications for sale on-line
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
